newsitem.title: USA: Pa. Beaver Valley 2 nuke seen fully back mid-week.
newsitem.headline: Pa. Beaver Valley 2 nuke seen fully back mid-week.

text.p: The 833 megawatt (MW) Beaver Valley 2 nuclear generating unit was expected to resume full operation mid-week after synchronizing to the regional grid Monday, the operator said.

"Beaver Valley power station unit 2 came back on line at 0606 (EST) today, scheduled to reach full production by mid-week," said a spokesman for the operator Duquesne Light Co, a subsidiary of DQE Inc.
The unit, in Shippingport, Pa., was originally shut August 30 for refueling, but its early December restart was pushed back for repairs of its vessel head vent system.
DQE holds a 13.7 percent stake in Beaver Valley 2, while Ohio Edison owns 41.9 percent and Centerior Energy has 44.4 percent.
